channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IN

item.title: Report E-2023090783
item.description:
Report E-2023090783

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-21
  • City: Connersville
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RECLAIMED ENERGY CO., INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1 drum of waste can in from Brook and Whittle. Lab determined that material was hazardous. Flash point < 140F. Material was shipped without a D001 waste code. I am doing the notification that the waste was shipped as an undeclared hazardous material.

item.title: Report E-2023090745
item.description:
Report E-2023090745

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: TAYLORSVILLE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stopped in rout at a rest area and was doing a load check and noticed a clear liquid dripping form the trailer. The driver then call out Emergency Response Line and a crew was sent to the location. The Crew showed up within the hour to start the clean up process. The crew put on the proper PPE and entered the trailer to find the appropriate container. The container was located midway in the trailer and pin hole in the bottom of the 55 Gallon drum was found to be the cause. they used absorbent cloths and material to collect what had been released. The absorbents and the damaged drum was put into a salvage drum to be disposed of properly.

item.title: Report X-2023090265
item.description:
Report X-2023090265

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-29
  • City: NEW HAVEN
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Trailer was being unloaded before QA arrived. Unload manager made sure area was cleared and contacted QA once one was available. Spill was contained by absorbent pads and package was secured into a bagged tote to await processing. DescribePack: Cap of one bottle had fallen off. Cap looks intact so it may not have been secured before shipping. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent pads were used immediately to slow spread. Belt was stopped and other packages were held back to prevent contamination.

item.title: Report X-2023082037
item.description:
Report X-2023082037

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-26T18:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-28
  • City: LAFAYETTE
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was found leaking while unloading it from the trailer. It was sent to the QA cage, where it was placed in a hazmat tote until it could be processed. DescribePack: One bottle had a loose cap which caused contents to leak into pkg. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a hazmat tote.
